worklogs.comment:
HyukjinKwon commented on pull request #4478: ARROW-4723: [Python] Add regex pattern support to ignore custom "hidden" files
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4478
 
 
   This PR proposes to add new global variable called `REGEX_EXCLUDED_PARQUET_PATHS` to support a regex pattern to ignore custom hidden files when it reads Parquet files.
   
   Currently, `EXCLUDED_PARQUET_PATHS` is given but arguably more often those custom hidden files have non-fixed names but with a pattern (with prefix and/or suffix), for example `'_$folder$'` in S3.
   
   It also can be a workaround in case lower version of pyarrow for such cases:
   
   ```
           return (file_name.endswith('.crc') or  # Checksums
                   file_name.endswith('_$folder$') or  # HDFS directories in S3
                   file_name.startswith('.') or  # Hidden files
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

wesm commented on issue #4478: ARROW-4723: [Python] Add regex pattern support to ignore custom "hidden" files
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4478#issuecomment-499108136
 
 
   Does it make sense to exclude any file that starts with an underscore? How do other Parquet implementations handle this?
   
   Note that pyarrow/parquet.py is on death row -- this module is going to be largely ported to C++ so we can maintain a common Dataset codebase for use in Python, R, Ruby, MATLAB, and other programming languages that link to C++
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

users@infra.apache.org

mengxr commented on issue #4478: ARROW-4723: [Python] Add regex pattern support to ignore custom "hidden" files
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4478#issuecomment-499153013
 
 
   Ignoring underscore files is a Hadoop convention. parquet-mr implemented it by default: https://github.com/apache/parquet-mr/blob/d1e9f15d1e94956f38880fec2cf9491b8f9711e4/parquet-hadoop/src/main/java/org/apache/parquet/hadoop/util/HiddenFileFilter.java#L37. Not sure if it is part of parquet specs, likely not.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

HyukjinKwon commented on issue #4478: ARROW-4723: [Python] Add regex pattern support to ignore custom "hidden" files
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4478#issuecomment-499153196
 
 
   Thanks, @wesm. Yes, I think it makes more sense to just exclude all files starting with underscore. I was checking the code history and thought Arrow didn't want to exclude it.
   
   As far as I remember, Parquet MR library itself also skips hidden files (which starts with `.` or `_`) unless the path is explicitly set to Parquet readers. Hadoop's FileInputFormat skips them.
   
   In case of Spark, it filters at Spark layer so I am not 100% sure about Parquet. In any event, I am +100 to just exclude the files starting underscore.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

HyukjinKwon commented on issue #4478: ARROW-4723: [Python] Add regex pattern support to ignore custom "hidden" files
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4478#issuecomment-499157127
 
 
   BTW, seems like this code path wants to accept Hive style partition directories. Spark uses a condition like this:
   
   ```scala
       // We filter follow paths:
       // 1. everything that starts with _ and ., except _common_metadata and _metadata
       // because Parquet needs to find those metadata files from leaf files returned by this method.
       // We should refactor this logic to not mix metadata files with data files.
       // 2. everything that ends with `._COPYING_`, because this is a intermediate state of file. we
       // should skip this file in case of double reading.
       val exclude = (pathName.startsWith("_") && !pathName.contains("=")) ||
         pathName.startsWith(".") || pathName.endsWith("._COPYING_")
       val include = pathName.startsWith("_common_metadata") || pathName.startsWith("_metadata")
       exclude && !include
   ```
   
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
It is common for Apache Spark or other big data platforms to save additional meta-data files denoted with _ when saving parquet data.

When using  {{make_batch_reader}} to load a directory saved by parquet containing such files we encounter the following error:
{code:java}
PetastormMetadataError Traceback (most recent call last)
/databricks/python/lib/python3.6/site-packages/petastorm/etl/dataset_metadata.py in infer_or_load_unischema(dataset)
    388 try:
--> 389 return get_schema(dataset) 
    390 except PetastormMetadataError:

/databricks/python/lib/python3.6/site-packages/petastorm/etl/dataset_metadata.py in get_schema(dataset)
    342 raise PetastormMetadataError( 
--> 343 'Could not find _common_metadata file. Use materialize_dataset(..) in' 
    344 ' petastorm.etl.dataset_metadata.py to generate this file in your ETL code.'

PetastormMetadataError: Could not find _common_metadata file. Use materialize_dataset(..) in petastorm.etl.dataset_metadata.py to generate this file in your ETL code. You can generate it on an existing dataset using petastorm-generate-metadata.py{code}
 

This is because our Runtime stores the following two files at the end of the job:
{code:java}
dbfs:/tmp/petastorm/_committed_4686077819843716563	_committed_4686077819843716563	1965
dbfs:/tmp/petastorm/_started_4686077819843716563{code}
fields.summary: [Python] Skip _files when reading a directory containing parquet files
